column1: Bazpur is a city and a municipality in Udham Singh Nagar district  in the state of Uttarakhand
Bazpur is well connected with the industrial city of Rudrapur and the historical city of Kashipur. It is an affluent town
column2: mainly due to large agricultural estates. It was initially
column3: like most of the area which forms present day Udham Singh Nagar District
column5: and was gradually transformed into arable land by migrants from Punjab. Most of the early settlers were those rendered homeless by the Partition of India in 1947.

column1: It was in Bajpur that India's first co-operative sugar mill went into production on 16 February 1959.Website: https://www.bazpur.com
It was established in early in 17th century
column4: and named after a former Chand king
column5: Baz Bahadur. Bazpur has the singular achievement of possessing the first co-operative sugar mill
column6: which was dedicated to the nation by Jawahar Lal Nehru. It was the first effort of establishment of a sugar factory in the co-operative sector
column7: which went into production on 16 February 1959.

column3: 782. Males constitute 55% of the population and females 45%. Bazpur has an average literacy rate of 66%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%; with 60% of the males and 40% of females literate. 14% of the population is under 6 years of age.
